episodeTitle: Perona is Terrified!! Usopp and Untruthful Share the Same 'U'
description: Usopp continues his clever battle against Perona, discovering her physical body's location after deducing that her ghost form is merely her separated spirit. Using psychological warfare and strategic deception, Usopp defeats the Ghost Princess with fake cockroaches and an inflatable hammer.

events.title: Usopp Deduces Perona's True Body Location
events.description: Usopp realizes that the Perona he's been fighting is merely her ghost form created by separating her spirit from her physical body. He deduces that her real body must be hidden somewhere safe in Thriller Bark, likely in her room.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's tactical intelligence and observation skills. This realization is crucial to defeating Perona, as her ghost form is invulnerable but her physical body is not.

quotes.text: That's it! The Perona I've been fighting is just a ghost! Her real body must be hidden somewhere safe!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's crucial realization about Perona's ability

events.title: Usopp Discovers Perona's Physical Body
events.description: Following his deduction, Usopp locates Perona's real physical body in her room. She lies unconscious on her bed while her ghost form continues to fight him elsewhere.
events.significance: Confirms Usopp's theory and gives him a strategic advantage in the battle. This discovery allows him to target her vulnerability.

events.title: Usopp Uses Torimochi Boshi on Perona
events.description: Usopp fires what appears to be a regular attack at Perona's physical body, but it seemingly misses. However, this is revealed later to be Torimochi Boshi (Birdlime Star), a sticky projectile designed to immobilize his target.
events.significance: First use of this adhesive technique, showcasing Usopp's strategic planning and misdirection tactics. This technique proves crucial in trapping Perona later.

events.title: Perona Creates Toku Hollow
events.description: Believing she has the upper hand after Usopp's apparent miss, Perona unleashes Toku Hollow (Special Hollow), a massive ghost at least four times the size of Usopp. The giant hollow grabs Usopp in its mouth, trapping him.
events.significance: Demonstrates Perona's most powerful ghost technique, showing the escalation of the battle and the threat level Usopp faces.

quotes.text: Meet my Special Hollow! You can't escape from its grip!
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Perona revealing her most powerful ghost attack

events.title: Perona Uses Kamikaze Rap
events.description: With Usopp trapped in the Special Hollow's mouth, Perona detonates it using Kamikaze Rap, creating a massive explosion meant to finish off the sniper.
events.significance: Reveals the explosive capability of Perona's ghosts, showing her lethal intent and the danger Usopp faces in this battle.

events.title: Usopp Uses Impact Dial to Absorb Explosion
events.description: Just as Perona's Kamikaze Rap explodes, Usopp reveals he had prepared an Impact Dial (obtained from Skypiea) which absorbs the entire explosion, saving his life.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's strategic preparation and resourcefulness, using equipment from a previous arc to counter Perona's attack. Shows the continuity of the Straw Hats' adventures.

quotes.text: Impact Dial! I've been saving this for just the right moment!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp using Skypiea technology to survive Perona's explosion

events.title: Usopp Reveals His Trap - Perona Immobilized
events.description: Usopp reveals that his earlier 'missed' shot was actually Torimochi Boshi that stuck Perona's arm to the wall, immobilizing her physical body. With her real body trapped, she cannot escape his next attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's tactical genius, revealing his multi-step plan that was in motion from the beginning. This is the turning point where his victory becomes inevitable.

quotes.text: Did you really think I missed? That was Torimochi Boshi - your arm is stuck to the wall! You can't escape now!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp revealing his trap to Perona

events.title: Usopp Uses Gokiburi Boshi - Cockroach Attack
events.description: Usopp fires Gokiburi Boshi (Cockroach Star) at the immobilized Perona, covering her with hundreds of what appear to be moving cockroaches. Perona screams in terror, revealing her intense fear of insects.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's psychological warfare tactics and his ability to exploit opponents' fears. The cockroaches are later revealed to be fake toys, showing Usopp's reliance on deception over brute force.

quotes.text: Gokiburi Boshi! Time to see what really scares you, Ghost Princess!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Usopp Golden Pound - The Finishing Blow
events.description: As Perona screams and begs for mercy covered in fake cockroaches, Usopp appears wielding what looks like a massive ten-ton hammer called Usopp Golden Pound. He swings it down on Perona, and she faints from fear as the hammer bursts apart, revealing it was merely an inflatable balloon.
events.significance: Marks Usopp's victory over Perona using pure psychological warfare and trickery. This demonstrates that in One Piece, intelligence and creativity can overcome raw power, perfectly embodying Usopp's fighting style.

quotes.text: Usopp Golden Pound! This ten-ton hammer will finish you!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's bluff before delivering the final psychological blow

quotes.text: Please spare me! I'm sorry! Don't hit me with that!
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Perona begging before fainting in fear

events.title: Usopp Defeats Perona
events.description: Perona collapses unconscious, foaming at the mouth from the psychological trauma of the fake cockroaches and hammer. Usopp celebrates his victory over one of the Mysterious Four, having defeated her without using any real weapons or causing physical harm.
events.significance: One of Usopp's most impressive victories in the series, showcasing his growth as a warrior who uses his brain over brawn. This removes one of Moria's commanders from the battle and proves Usopp's value to the crew.

quotes.text: Victory! The Great Captain Usopp triumphs again!
quotes.speaker: Usopp

events.title: Luffy Struggles Against Doppelman
events.description: Brief scenes show Luffy continuing his battle against Doppelman, Gecko Moria's shadow clone. Luffy finds it difficult to land effective hits on the shadow creature.
events.significance: Maintains the parallel narrative of other ongoing battles in Thriller Bark, showing that the entire crew is engaged in combat simultaneously.

events.title: Robin and Chopper Fight Zombie Generals
events.description: Robin and Chopper continue battling against General Zombies Jigoro (with Zoro's shadow) and Inuppe (with Sanji's shadow), struggling against opponents with their crewmates' fighting styles.
events.significance: Emphasizes the challenge of fighting against zombies that possess the skills of their own nakama, adding psychological difficulty to the physical battle.

events.title: Zoro and Ryuma's Battle Preview
events.description: The episode ends with scenes teasing the ongoing rooftop battle between Zoro and the legendary samurai zombie Ryuma, setting up the next episode's focus.
events.significance: Provides foreshadowing for one of the arc's most important duels, building anticipation for Zoro's fight to reclaim Brook's shadow.

themes.description: The episode showcases how Usopp defeats a much more powerful opponent through careful observation, strategic planning, and psychological warfare rather than raw power. His victory demonstrates that creativity and intelligence can overcome supernatural abilities.
themes.symbolism: The fake cockroaches and inflatable hammer symbolize Usopp's philosophy that perception and fear are often more powerful than reality. His entire victory is built on making his opponent believe in threats that don't actually exist.

themes.description: Usopp's victory hinges on identifying and exploiting Perona's specific weaknesses - her separated physical body and her fear of insects. This demonstrates the importance of observation and adaptation in combat.
themes.symbolism: The separation between Perona's ghost form and physical body represents the vulnerability that comes with overconfidence in one's abilities.

themes.description: Despite being terrified throughout the battle, Usopp perseveres and outsmarts his opponent. His cowardice becomes irrelevant when he channels his fear into creative problem-solving.
themes.symbolism: Usopp overcoming someone who weaponizes fear and negativity with his own brand of fearful resourcefulness shows that even the most frightened person can be brave when it matters.

themes.description: The episode celebrates Usopp's signature fighting style of lies and tricks. Every major move in the battle involves misdirection - the 'missed' shot, the fake cockroaches, the inflatable hammer.
themes.symbolism: The 'U' in Usopp's name connects to 'uso' (嘘), the Japanese word for lie, making deception fundamental to his identity and fighting style.
culturalReferences: The episode title plays on the Japanese word 'uso' (嘘) meaning 'lie' or 'falsehood', connecting it to Usopp's name and his trickster nature.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates significant growth as a warrior, using his intelligence and creativity to defeat one of the arc's main antagonists. His victory over Perona showcases his evolution from a purely comedic character to a genuinely valuable combatant who wins through strategy.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended Usopp's comedic reactions and the battle sequences, adding more visual gags and extended the scenes of Perona's fear responses for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: The episode title contains a wordplay on 'uso' (嘘), meaning 'lie' in Japanese, which connects to Usopp's name and his trickster fighting style. The 'U' sound links his identity to deception.
The Impact Dial that Usopp uses in this episode was obtained during the Skypiea arc (episodes 195-197), demonstrating the continuity of equipment and tactics across arcs.
This is considered one of Usopp's most impressive solo victories in the series, as he defeats a powerful Devil Fruit user without relying on brute force or causing any real physical damage.

trivia.fact: The battle parallels Luffy vs. Enel from the Skypiea arc, where a character's unique trait (Usopp's negativity, Luffy's rubber body) makes them the natural counter to a seemingly invincible opponent.
This episode covers Chapter 466 (pages 2-15) of the manga, titled 'Conclusion', which marks the end of the Usopp vs. Perona fight.
